title.narrative: EU REACH regulation capacity building for South East Asian export companies Phase 2

description.narrative: Project goal is to establish a subsidiary for providing consulting and education services about the EU REACH regulation. Additionally the intention is to conclude long-term agreements in order to carry out the overall concept in Vietnam. Phase 2 is to cre ate a multi-channel service system for small medium and large businesses. The commercial offer to medium and large companies is for those whose size and scale of production requires more in-depth consultation. This customer group Chementors manages by its own local staff.The Support Center for small and handicraft companies distributes free basic information about the entire REACH certification and guides the customer through the procedures for applying for a certificate. The goal is also to find partners t o meet the needs of Support Center customers in certification. The Support Center strives to direct the companies to the partner's services while the partner relies on Chementors services. Small business advisory and guidance services are not commercially sustainable and must be based on external funding. As a completely new opportunity we are trying to develop new partnerships in the field of chemical waste management which have received a lot of inquiries (Hazardous Chemicals) as well as substitute substa nces. There also seems to be demand for the compilation of safety data sheets in Vietnam with little supply available.The Support Center is likely to work with the PPP method where Chementors designs builds and operates the service and may be funded by gov ernment / local government or ODA operators. The first discussions with the ministry have taken place which keeps the idea good. It is important to note that under the REACH Directive all non-EU suppliers must have a representative within the EU so that th e service chain must extend from Vietnam to the EU. Chementors specializes in this service and Vietnamese partners can use Chementor services in the EU.
